sentence.Network_en: " You can carry that blue knapsack. I'll take the tan one and the tripod. "
sentence.Network_cn: “ 你可以帮着拿那个蓝背包, 我拿那个土黄色的和三脚架. ”

sentence.Network_en: Franklin placed the warm scarf Debbie had knitted for him in the top of his knapsack.
sentence.Network_cn: 富兰克林把黛比为他织的暖和的围巾放在背包的最上层.

sentence.Network_en: The moment he received the order, the soldier packed his knapsack.
sentence.Network_cn: 士兵一接到命令就打了背包.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Middle Low German, from Dutch knapzack, probably from German knappen 'to bite' + zak 'sack'

entry.def: A knapsack is a canvas or leather bag that you carry on your back or over your shoulder, for example when you are walking in the countryside.

means.word_mean: 1. a bag carried by a strap on your back or shoulder

auth_sentence.content: Ford got a video camera from his knapsack.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ford got a video camera from his knapsack.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ford got a video camera from his knapsack.

auth_sentence.content: My knapsack,...with those six ponderous tomes of Bancroft, weighed me double.
auth_sentence.res_content: My knapsack,...with those six ponderous tomes of Bancroft, weighed me double.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My knapsack,...with those six ponderous tomes of Bancroft, weighed me double.

auth_sentence.content: But there is another important item for your knapsack and mind you don't forget it: poetry.
auth_sentence.res_content: But there is another important item for your knapsack and mind you don't forget it: poetry.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But there is another important item for your knapsack and mind you don't forget it: poetry.

sentences.en: After a short rest,they took up their knapsacks and went on.
sentences.cn: 休息了一会儿之后,他们又背起背包上路了。
